title: Chapter 419
content: # Chapter 419 The broadcast feed exploded with commentary. *"Skull and Lauel have been logged out!"* *"The survivors of the US team have started to retreat."* *"It's a big matter that Kraugel alone tied up three rankers. Russia has the numerical superiority."* *"Zibal survived, but his loss in power is severe. The United States seems to be getting further away from the medal."* *"Who could've imagined that a strong champion like the United States would be knocked out? Amazing! Kraugel is really great!"* Since Satisfy's opening, Kraugel had held first place on the unified rankings. The problem was his nature. He acted alone. Never appeared in public. The audience had no chance to witness his skills firsthand. They could only guess at his strength based on rumors from the few rankers who'd crossed his path. Most people assumed the nicknames were inflated. Exaggerations born from hearsay and myth-making. Today shattered that assumption. The viewers saw Kraugel directly. They watched him dismantle three rankers with surgical precision. The rumors weren't exaggerated. They weren't accurate *enough*. Kraugel was something beyond their understanding. *** "So what if the trivial monkey is good at fighting?" The skinheads of Russia showed their teeth. Over the past century, they'd assaulted or killed over 100,000 Asians. The Koryoin were no exception. Koreans who'd acquired Russian citizenship and lived there for generations meant nothing to these men. They received only threats. Only contempt. In 2005, a Koryoin Russian karate champion named Yakov Khan was murdered by skinheads. The incident made headlines for a week, then vanished. "What are you doing? The competition isn't over yet." Alexander stood over him. Ranked 22nd overall. A skinhead who treated Kraugel as something less than human. He didn't cheer. Didn't honor. Didn't respect the man who'd just delivered Russia's victory. He looked at Kraugel the way someone looks at a trained dog. Kraugel had led Russia to victory by defeating Jishuka, Skull, and Lauel. Now he couldn't even stand properly. His body trembled with exhaustion. Alexander leaned down. "Shake it off and keep going. Don't you have to work hard to treat your mother's disease?" Silence. "What? You're not getting up?" Alexander knew exactly why Kraugel was here. He exploited it thoroughly. "Oh, I'm not feeling motivated anymore." Alexander stretched. "I am tired of playing in the National Competition, so how about I quit and take a break?" "I'm sorry." Kraugel's voice was flat. "I'll get up." He caught Alexander's arm before the man could make good on his threat. His legs shook as he forced himself upright. Alexander pointed at the scoreboard with mock concern. "While we were fighting the United States, South Korea took back the number one spot. If you don't want to miss out on the gold medal, you need to shatter them." Kraugel stared at the numbers. "I will do so." A new medicine existed that could treat his mother's disease. It would take at least two years before commercialization. Kraugel couldn't wait that long. He firmed his resolve and pushed the exhaustion down. *** Grid checked the scoreboard. His jaw tightened. **1st. South Korea - 244 points.** **2nd. Russia - 195 points.** **3rd. United States - 167 points.** **4th. Canada - 153 points.** **5th. United Kingdom - 119 points.** *The score of the Russians has started to rise again.* The battle between the US and Russia had ended in Russia's victory. "As expected from Kraugel." The average power of the United States was higher than Russia. The US lost due to one variable. Kraugel. Yura and Peak Sword seemed surprised. Grid wasn't. *I can't play a more active role on this stage than Kraugel.* He'd defeated Kraugel once before. Only because Kraugel wasn't in perfect condition. It was natural for Kraugel to achieve this. He was that strong. Grid exhaled slowly. South Korea had regained first place, but the situation wasn't good. His God Hands accumulated points slowly and steadily. Peak Sword was limited to close range. Yura consumed mana with every shot. Her target processing speed had dropped. The targets flying through the sky were too small, too fast. *It would be a great help if Park Jonghwa was still alive.* Grid calculated the odds. Russia and Canada would eventually overtake them. *The secret to how Russia is able to reach here.* They weaponized Kraugel. He moved through Tira alone, eliminating every threat to Russia. Right now, the threat was South Korea. Kraugel would need to move again for Russia to secure victory. South Korea would be his target. *Kraugel will soon attack.* Grid ran the scenario. What would happen if they fought? *South Korea will lose.* Even if Grid caught Kraugel's ankle, only Yura and Peak Sword could handle targets. Their scoring speed would crawl. Russia would catch up regardless. *If Yura and Peak Sword can confront Kraugel...* Counterproductive. Yura had grown quickly through the vampire cities and the Behen Archipelago, but she was still only level 260. Peak Sword wasn't Kraugel's opponent. Never had been. Grid could handle dozens of targets before his teammates were logged out. Then he'd be alone. The result didn't change. South Korea would be defeated. *How to get first?* An ordinary player would've abandoned the gold medal. Grid wasn't ordinary. Like Kraugel, he possessed destructive power that overturned common sense. He could do something. *What if I hit Russia?* Yes. He didn't have to face Kraugel directly. While Kraugel ran here to confront Yura and Peak Sword, Grid would run there and smash the Russian team. *Afterwards, avoid Kraugel's pursuit and handle the targets with the God Hands.* Canada remained a problem. But Korea, Canada, and Russia weren't the only countries on the battlefield. Britain, Argentina, China, and Japan were still in relatively good condition. They were aiming for medals too. They would read the situation and keep Canada in check. "Okay." Most of his skill cooldowns had returned. His mana had recovered enough. Grid made his decision and turned to Yura and Peak Sword. "Stand out so that you will be Kraugel's target. When he attacks, escape as far as possible and buy time." "Grid, don't tell me..." Yura's eyes widened. She was smart. Peak Sword had led a guild. They figured out his plan immediately. "Are you going to strike Russia alone?" "It's too dangerous, even if you're God Grid!" Peak Sword grabbed his arm. "Russia didn't beat the United States just because of Kraugel. The average power of Russia is strong, especially Alexander!" "High risk, high return." Grid pulled his arm free. "If we want the best result, I have to take this risk." He entered the forest before they could argue further. Peak Sword stared at his back. "It is high risk, not high list..." Kindergartens taught English these days. Shouldn't Grid know more? Peak Sword felt very good about his own English, despite his vocabulary being limited to 'Do you know?' *** "South Korea's scoring rate has slowed down?" "Is Kraugel already raiding Korea's base?" "No, Kraugel is tired. It will take him considerable time to reach the Korean base. Even if he reaches it, he won't pose a great threat to Grid." "Then why is South Korea's score rising so slowly?" "Are they frightened of Kraugel?" "Well, there is Yura in the Korean team. She will quickly identify that she is Kraugel's next target." "Cowards." The Russian representatives stood on the mountain that was originally the US team's base. Their scoring speed was very fast. At least five times faster than South Korea. A reversal would happen soon. One of the rankers turned to Alexander. "Isn't it better not to bother Kraugel so much in the National Competition?" "I also agree." Another nodded. "Kraugel is currently our largest power. It could backfire if you keep crushing his pride and morale." The other Russians didn't know why Kraugel participated. They assumed he wanted a gold medal and rewards like themselves. Alexander snorted. "Don't worry. He wants to win the championship for Russia more than anyone else. He will do his best to the end, even if he's treated as a dog." Alexander hated Kraugel. He felt honored to participate to make Russia great. He couldn't stand someone who participated for personal reasons. It made him want to crush Kraugel even more. The Russian representatives chatted while handling targets. "Are you harassing Kraugel? Hyenas bothering a lion?" The voice was familiar but wrong. Alexander and the other Russian rankers looked toward the sound. "You..." "Grid?" Why was this bastard here? The Russian representatives figured it out quickly. "Hoh, I see. You want to hit us while Kraugel hits South Korea?" One of them grinned. "Planning to raid us alone, you're crazy. Didn't you just come here to die?" "You hit a couple of small fries and think you are so great?" "You aren't Kraugel. Did you call us hyenas and Kraugel a lion? Then you are a dog. A dog." Grid had been bullied throughout school. He hated harassment. He could guess Kraugel's position after hearing their conversation. His eyes sharpened. "I'm a tiger, dumb bastards." The sound of metal scraping metal filled the air as he activated Item Combination. Grid's Greatsword and Failure merged. The weapon in his hands now possessed the highest attack power he could generate. "Transcended Link." His voice was cold. "Linked Kill Wave." The bombardment struck the Russian team. *BOOM BOOM BOOM BOOM BOOM BOOM BOOM BOOM!* Energy blades tore through the air. More threatening than a storm. They destroyed the edge of the mountain peak. Lauel had caused a landslide by exploiting terrain. Grid caused a landslide using pure destructive power. The Russian representatives screamed as the mountain collapsed beneath them. *** **Glossary of Common Korean Terms.** **OG: Glossary Link.** **Current schedule: 20 chapters a week.** **Check out my Patreon for early access to a certain number of unedited chapters and well as achieve the goals for extra chapters. The early access chapters will be updated after I finish releasing all chapters for the day.**
